body_html:
The int32 are pinned to CPU because they are typically metadata operations. So, you will expect (silently) slower operations if you use int32, on GPU.

That said, I don't see a reason why we can't have that operation and we should add it.
body_text:
The int32 are pinned to CPU because they are typically metadata operations. So, you will expect (silently) slower operations if you use int32, on GPU.
That said, I don't see a reason why we can't have that operation and we should add it.
body:
The `int32` are pinned to CPU because they are typically metadata operations. So, you will expect (silently) slower operations if you use `int32`, on GPU.

That said, I don't see a reason why we can't have that operation and we should add it.
